Description: Painted wooden shabti of Šmʿyt n Imn Inh3y with a black lappet-wig, a brown modelled face with black and white eyes, a blue, green and white collar that encloses the parallel brown hands in low relief holding two red hoes; the yellow leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs flanked by six similar rows; the back(damaged) is decorated with a red and yellow representation of a seed-basket beneath a red yoke with two pendular nw-pots(one missing).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
